IMeshFaceBuffer Interface Reference
[MESH+ Module]

import "meshplus.idl";

Inheritance diagram for IMeshFaceBuffer:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

MESH+ Face Buffer.

Buffer specialization for Face Buffers. Buffers are highly platform-dependent and therefore implementation is done in external module, normally in External Module: FWRender. Each face consists of three vertex indices and represents a single triangle. Single buffer may contain triangles for several different meshes, however the user must keep track of the ranges relating to consecutive meshes.

See also:
Buffer Creation and Usage

Implementation in FWRender::MeshDX9FaceBuffer

HRESULT Create ([in] FWULONG nSize)
 Creates the buffer.

HRESULT GetFormat ([out] FWULONG *nBitsPerIndex)
 Retrieves the actual format (size) of the buffer, which is the number of bits per vertex index (usually 16 or 32).

Member Function Documentation

HRESULT IMeshFaceBuffer::Create (  [in] FWULONG  nSize  ) 
 

Creates the buffer.

Creates nSize items, each is a triple of vertex indices. Therefore the actual length of buffer is nSize * 3 * sizeof(INDEX) bytes.
